Award.AwardTitle: SBIR Phase I: High Performance Millimeter-Wave RF Front-End Technology for Multi-Gigabit Wireless Communications
Award.AbstractNarration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this SBIR Phase I project is significant since the platform is an enabler of a range of high-speed wireless applications for the next generation of broadband communications. The proposed technology platform will solve some of the key challenges of millimeter-wave (MMW) wireless radios and networks and can serve a wide set of wireless related applications and markets, particularly the telecommunication backhaul and fixed wireless access markets, among others. This Radio Frequency (RF) front-end system, integrated with the base-band circuitry in a wireless module, provides the hardware necessary to enable the vision of a truly fiber-speed backhaul network for 10s of millions of 5th generation (5G) cell deployments to provide the ultimate network robustness, agility, with significant cost savings for the operators and businesses. This advanced wireless technology will enable rapid and robust roll-out of the next generation network as well as a wide range of broadband wireless applications and can play a pivotal role in overall pace of 5G technology penetration. This in turn will impact many industry sectors, ranging from smart transportation, manufacturing, and healthcare to smart city, and the Internet of Things.

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project aims to develop an ultra-high performance MMW wireless RF front-end technology for the next generation of multi-gigabit applications. Driven by the rising demand of the data-intensive applications, there is a growing need for more advanced wireless equipment for high data-rate communications. That is why with the emergence of multi-gigabit applications, there is a significant focus on MMW technology as the frontier of the wireless communication. The existing MMW RF front-end technologies, however, are either limited in their functionality or suffer from high power-consumption, which makes them not suitable for emerging massive deployments such as 5G backhaul, last-mile broadband for enterprise and service providers, etc. As a result, there is a need for new MMW RF front-end technologies to unlock the full potential of fiber-speed wireless communications. The proposed technology offers an order of magnitude higher performance compared to the best-in-class wireless technologies and can serve as an enabler to multiple high-speed applications.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The goal of this SBIR Phase I project is to demonstrate an ultra-high-performance millimeter-wave (mmWave) RF front-end technology for the next generation of multi-gigabit wireless applications. Driven by the rising demand of the data-intensive applications, there is a growing need for more advanced wireless equipment for high data-rate communications. That is why with the emergence of multi-gigabit applications, there is a significant focus on mmWave technology as the frontier of the wireless communication. Wedged between microwave and infrared waves, mmWave band offers significantly wider bandwidth compared to the existing RF and microwave wireless bands, which in turn enables unprecedented connection speeds. This has recently motivated Federal Communications Commission (FCC) and other international standards to open several frequency bands at mmWave spectrum for various communication applications including 5G telecommunications, wireless infrastructure, etc. The existing mmWave RF front-end technologies, however, are either limited in their functionality or suffer from high power-consumption, which makes them not suitable for emerging massive deployments such as 5G backhaul, last-mile broadband for enterprise and service providers, etc. As a result, there is a need for new mmWave RF front-end technologies to unlock the full potential of fiber-speed wireless communications.

Focusing on this unmet need and by leveraging SkyGig's patented mmWave technology, through this SBIR Phase I effort we have successfully demonstrated 5G implementation of an antenna technology as an enabler of a whole new class of mmWave Radio Access Network (RAN) devices that offers an order of magnitude higher aggregated throughput and capacity, longer coverage range, and low latency compared to the best-in-class solutions. This SBIR Phase I effort successfully establishes the feasibility of this patented mmWave RF front-end technology as the core of the 5G RAN device, demonstrates its key distinctive features for future network expansions, and provides a complete plan for SkyGig's follow-on technology development and commercialization of this technology, where we will focus on development of a turnkey mmWave front-end solution. This mmWave RF front-end system, integrated with the base-band circuitry in a wireless module, provides the hardware necessary to enable the vision of a truly fiber-speed network for 10s of millions of 5G and beyond 5G network deployments and provides the ultimate network robustness, agility, with significant cost savings for the operators and businesses. The broader impact/commercial potential of this SBIR Phase I project is significant since the platform is an enabler of a range of high-speed wireless applications for the next generation of broadband communications. This advanced wireless technology will enable rapid and robust roll-out of the next generation network and can play a pivotal role in overall pace of 5G technology penetration and beyond. This in turn will virtually impact every industry sector, ranging from automotive, manufacturing, healthcare to smart city Internet of Things (IoT) and smart home, with trillions of dollars at stake.


Last Modified: 08/04/2021
Modified by: Armin Jam

Driven by the rising demand of the data-intensive applications, there is a growing need for more advanced wireless equipment for high data-rate communications. Wedged between microwave and infrared waves, mmWave band offers significantly wider bandwidth compared to the existing RF and microwave wireless bands, which in turn enables unprecedented connection speeds. This has recently motivated Federal Communications Commission (FCC) and other international standards to open several frequency bands at mmWave spectrum for various communication applications including 5G telecommunications, wireless infrastructure, etc. The existing mmWave RF front-end technologies, however, are either limited in their functionality or suffer from high power-consumption, which makes them not suitable for emerging massive deployments such as 5G backhaul, last-mile broadband for enterprise and service providers, etc. As a result, there is a need for new mmWave RF front-end technologies to unlock the full potential of fiber-speed wireless communications. This mmWave RF front-end system, integrated with the base-band circuitry in a wireless module, provides the hardware necessary to enable the vision of a truly fiber-speed network for 10s of millions of 5G and beyond 5G network deployments and provides the ultimate network robustness, agility, with significant cost savings for the operators and businesses. This advanced wireless technology will enable rapid and robust roll-out of the next generation network and can play a pivotal role in overall pace of 5G technology penetration and beyond. This in turn will virtually impact every industry sector, ranging from automotive, manufacturing, healthcare to smart city Internet of Things (IoT) and smart home, with trillions of dollars at stake.
